Selected Answer: C
The answer is letter C, prints String main 1 2 3. When we pass something in the argument at the time of execution between " " we are saying that everything that is between quotes will occupy a single space in the array that in the case of "1 2 3" as it is on the command line it is at position 0 of the args array.

the correct answer is C if it was java 1 2 3

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about Java byte code? (Choose two.)

choices.E: It can run on any platform that has the Java Runtime Environment.
choices.A: It can be serialized across network.
choices.B: It can run on any platform that has a Java compiler.
choices.C: It can run on any platform.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
Answer is AE

Answer is AE, because:
B -> Wrong because it doesn’t need java compiler once java file is compiled.
C -> Wrong because System need Java Runtime Environment to run the program.
D -> Wrong because the java file convert to .class file once compiled.

choices.C: Its case label literals can be changed at runtime.
choices.D: It must contain the default section.
choices.B: The break statement, at the end of each case block, is optional.
choices.A: Its expression can evaluate to a collection of values.

questions.question_text: Which is true about the switch statement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. The break statement, at the end of each case block, is optional.

Selected Answer: D
The answer is the letter D, you don't have to go far, both the initial value of the variable "i" and "j" receive the length -1 and the matrix is 2x2. As java indexes from 0 and length is 2, the first number to be printed is 4 which is in position [1][1] of the array and only the letter D has 4 as the first. Don't even waste time doing the rest, in the OCA test they put distractors just for you to spend more time on the question, and having additional time is like gold in this exam.

Selected Answer: A
The answer is the letter A, in the line where the object is instantiated the values go to the object but when printing the program is directly accessing the values of the X and Y variables, pay close attention when answering this type of question.
